page.title: 13EDUCATION
page.content: Our group all live on farms around our school, which is situated on the north side of the Black-Isle. As we are not on direct routes to the school we have to get up early either to walk, cycle or go in a car to reach the school bus. School starts at 9.15a.m. and we do lessons then till 10.45. We have a tuck shop then which sells crisps, biscuits and chocolate and a teacher runs it. Our school has two teachers and 35 pupils. We have a visiting gym teacher who comes once a fortnight. We are also very lucky in having parents who come every Thursday for netball and football. The primary sevens from Newhall all go on to Fortrose Academy on the south side of the Black-Isle which has about 600 pupils, and is the only secondary school on the Black-Isle. cont. on page 14
